metadata.title: CVE-2017-14178 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In snapd 2.27 through 2.29.2 the 'snap logs' command could be made to calljournalctl without match arguments and therefore allow unprivileged,unauthenticated users to bypass systemd-journald's access restrictions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.29.4.2
snapd - 2.29.4.2
snapd-xdg-open - 2.29.4.2
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.29.4.2
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.29.4.2
ubuntu-snappy - 2.29.4.2
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.29.4.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.29.4.2').
